metadata.title: Convert Stone to Kilograms – Weight Converter
metadata.description: Convert weight from Stone to Kilograms (kg), useful for understanding UK and imperial weight measurements.

introduction: This converter transforms weight measurements from Stone to Kilograms, essential for UK to metric weight understanding.
The stone is primarily used in the UK and Ireland for body weight. Converting to kilograms enables metric comparison.
This converter uses the standard relationship where 1 stone equals approximately 6.35029 kilograms.
methodology: 1 stone = 6.35029 kg. To convert stone to kilograms, multiply by 6.35029. For example, 1 stone ≈ 6.35 kg, 10 stone ≈ 63.5 kg.
Body weight in the UK is often expressed in stone and pounds. Converting to kilograms helps with medical and fitness contexts.
Different regions use different weight units. Understanding conversion facilitates international communication.
This converter provides precise weight conversions for UK to metric contexts.
examples: Example 1 – Body weight: A 12-stone person weighs approximately 76.2 kg.
Example 2 – Fitness goal: Losing 1 stone equals losing approximately 6.35 kg.
Example 3 – Typical weight: An adult weighing 70 kg is approximately 11 stone.

faqs.question: What is the conversion from Stone to Kilograms?
faqs.answer: 1 stone ≈ 6.35029 kg. Multiply stone by 6.35029 to get kilograms.

faqs.question: Why use stone for weight?
faqs.answer: Historical tradition in UK and Ireland. Stone, pounds, and ounces were developed before the metric system.

faqs.question: How many pounds in a stone?
